includedAssets.title: Monsters, Inc.
includedAssets.synopsis: Two monsters break all the rules when a kid they're supposed to scare follows them back to their own world. Brilliant Pixar animation with the voice of John Goodman.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Two monsters break all the rules when a kid they're supposed to scare follows them back to their own world. Brilliant Pixar animation.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: Two monsters break all the rules when a kid they're supposed to scare follows them back to their own world. Brilliant Pixar animation with the voice of John Goodman.

includedAssets.title: Monsters University
includedAssets.synopsis: It's Monsters, Inc: The Student Days as the animation geniuses at Pixar take us back to Mike (voiced by Billy Crystal) and Sulley's (John Goodman) first year in college - when they didn't exactly see eye to eye. When their rivalry sees them kicked out of the university's prestigious Scare Program, the pair are forced to enter the annual Scare Games to regain their frightful place. As if the challenge wasn't tough enough, they have to win it with the least fearsome fraternity on campus. Whatever happens, the class of Pixar comes through with honours.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Monster mates Mike and Sulley set out on the road to becoming top scarers in this Disney Pixar prequel. Animation voiced by Billy Crystal.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: It's Monsters, Inc: The Student Days as the animation geniuses at Pixar take us back to Mike (voiced by Billy Crystal) and Sulley's (John Goodman) first year in college - when they didn't exactly see eye to eye. When their rivalry sees them kicked out of the university's prestigious Scare Program, the pair are forced to enter the annual Scare Games to regain their frightful place. As if the challenge wasn't tough enough, they have to win it with the least fearsome fraternity on campus. Whatever happens, the class of Pixar comes through with honours.

includedAssets.title: Monsters, Inc.
includedAssets.synopsis: Join loveable monsters Mike and Sully for two scarily brilliant animated adventures from the maestros at Pixar. The Oscar-winning Monsters Inc sees the pals dealing with a crisis when a supposedly toxic human child enters their world, while Monsters University tells the tale of their calamitous college days.
